DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluate acute effect vibration ( whole body vibration local muscle vibration ) quadriceps function , knee joint proprioception , gait biomechanics link osteoarthritis development individual anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction . Subjects randomly assign control ( vibration ) , whole body vibration , local muscle vibration group , aforementioned characteristic assess prior follow respective intervention .
DOC.brief_title: Vibratory Stimuli , A Novel Rehabilitation Method Preventing Post - Traumatic Knee Osteoarthritis
DOC.detailed_description: Quadriceps muscle dysfunction proprioceptive deficit follow knee injury alter walk gait biomechanics manner contribute development knee osteoarthritis . Current rehabilitation technique minimally effective address complication prevent knee osteoarthritis . Anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction dramatically increase risk knee osteoarthritis , represent ideal model evaluate novel rehabilitation technique prevent knee osteoarthritis . Direct ( local muscle vibration ) indirect ( whole body vibration ) vibratory stimuli enhance quadriceps function proprioception , may improve rehabilitation reduce risk knee osteoarthritis . The purpose investigation determine compare acute effect whole body vibration local muscle vibration quadriceps function , knee proprioception , gait biomechanics individual anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction . The investigator hypothesize vibratory stimulus enhance quadriceps function , knee proprioception , gait biomechanics manner would reduce risk develop knee osteoarthritis , whole body vibration local muscle vibration produce equivalent improvement characteristic .
DOC.criteria: age 1835 year undergone unilateral ACLR within 5 year prior participation least 6 month postACLR Knee Injury Osteoarthritis Outcome Score ( KOOS ) selfreport survey Pain subscale score > 53.1 Symptom subscale score > 44.9 cleared physician return physical activity , currently participate least 20 minute physical activity 3x per week . central activation ratio ( CAR ) > 95 % history ACL graft rupture revision surgery , neurological disorder , injury either leg within 6 month prior participation ( initial ACLR )
